H0.text: Global warming is the climate change most likely to cause the lowest land areas on Earth to be submerged beneath rising oceans in the next 200 years.

H1.text: Decreased winds are the climate change most likely to cause the lowest land areas on Earth to become submerged beneath rising oceans within the next 200 years.

H2.text: The start of an ice age would be the climate change most likely to cause the lowest land areas on Earth to be submerged beneath rising oceans within the next 200 years.

H3.text: Increased desertification is the climate change most likely to cause the lowest land areas on Earth to become submerged beneath rising oceans over the next 200 years.

A4.text: Global sea level is rising as a consequence of thermal expansion and the melting of glaciers and ice sheets.
